thread.title: Watch incredible moment non-league defender suddenly becomes Lionel Messi and scores sensational solo goal
thread.title_full: Watch incredible moment non-league defender suddenly becomes Lionel Messi and scores sensational solo goal

author: Jake Polden
title: Watch incredible moment non-league defender suddenly becomes Lionel Messi and scores sensational solo goal
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Every now and again non-league football throws up a little gem. 
It also very, very rarely throws up a big gem, which is exactly what we have in the above video from the Southern League Division One South and West. 
The clip captures Evesham United captain Linden Dovey doing what all good skippers do when their side is 2-0 down - lead by example. 
Although, Dovey manages to do a little bit more than just that - he first channels LIONEL MESSI , and then leads by example. Linden Dovey picks the ball up on the halfway line (Photo: YouTube/Hereford FC) The captain evades five defenders (Photo: YouTube/Hereford FC) 
In the video, the centre-back - yes you did hear that right, centre-back - picks the ball up on the half-way line. 
He then proceeds to run through the middle of the pitch and evade challenges from no less than FIVE Hereford United players. 
Admittedly not all five defenders come close enough to try to dispossess Dovey, but they do at the very least attempt to block him off/throw him off course. The skipper hits the back of the net with a long-range shot (Photo: YouTube/Hereford FC) Not quite as glamorous as the Southern League Division One South and West (Photo: Alex Caparros) 
But really, they shouldn't have even bothered because after going around them like cones, the centre-back smashes a shot at goal from just outside the area. 
And of course, hits the back of the net. 
Unbelievable stuff. It's just a shame the goal couldn't instigate a comeback for his side, who went on to lose the game 2-1. Like us on Facebook
